Detailed Description

Class to receive a packet from Datagram- or TCPsockets.

The functions are thread unsafe.

uint32  timeout = MAX_UINT32
)  [static]
 

Read and create a packet from readSocket.

Parameters:
readSocket The socket to read packet from.
timeout Timeout in microseconds.
Returns:
The Packet or NULL if fatal read error.

byte* PacketReceiver::readPacket (  TCPSocket *  readSocket,
uint32 &  bufferLength,
int &  packetLength,
uint32  timeout = MAX_UINT32
)  [static]
 

Read a packet data from readSocket.

Parameters:
readSocket The socket to read packet from.
bufferLength The length of the byte buffer.
packetLength The number of bytes used by the packet in buffer. Is less than or equal to bufferLength.
timeOut Timeout to use. Socket will be closed if it is exceeded.
Returns:
The buffer with the packet or NULL if fatal read error.

Packet* PacketReceiver::receiveAndCreatePacket (  int32  micros,
TCPSocket **  tcpReceiverSock = NULL
) 
 

Receive next incoming packet.

Parameters:
micros Time in microseconds before timeout. If < 0 then wait forever.
tcpReceiverSock Pointer to pointer to receiversocket if it still exists. Will not be set if null.
Returns:
A new Packet or NULL if read error.

The datagram-socket to remove.

Remove a TCPSocket from list of active receivers.
